Sentencas: Butanol partial oxidation for hydrogen-rich gas production has been studied by Gibbs free energy minimization method.
Titulo: Hydrogen-rich gas production for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) via partial oxidation of butanol: Thermodynamic analysis

Sentencas: The optimum conditions for hydrogen-rich gas production are identified: reaction temperatures between 1115 and 1200 K and oxygen-to-butanol molar ratios between 1.6 and 1.7 at 1 atm.
Titulo: Hydrogen-rich gas production for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) via partial oxidation of butanol: Thermodynamic analysis

Sentencas: Under the optimal conditions, complete conversion of butanol, 93.07%-96.56% yield of hydrogen and 94.02%-97.55% yield of carbon monoxide could be achieved in the absence of coke formation.
Titulo: Hydrogen-rich gas production for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) via partial oxidation of butanol: Thermodynamic analysis

Sentencas: The butanol partial oxidation with O(2) is suitable for providing hydrogen-rich fuels for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell (SOFC).
Titulo: Hydrogen-rich gas production for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) via partial oxidation of butanol: Thermodynamic analysis

Sentencas: Higher pressures have a negative effect, but inert gases have a positive effect, on the hydrogen yield.
Titulo: Hydrogen-rich gas production for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) via partial oxidation of butanol: Thermodynamic analysis

Sentencas: Coke tends to form at lower temperatures and lower oxygen-to-butanol molar ratios.
Titulo: Hydrogen-rich gas production for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) via partial oxidation of butanol: Thermodynamic analysis
